slides.content: Many beginners think Go doesn't have pointers like C/C++. Truth? Go **does** have pointers â€” just no pointer arithmetic.

slides.title: ğŸ“¦ Think of pointers as...
slides.content: A **home address** for your data. Instead of carrying the whole house (value), you just give the **address**.

slides.title: ğŸ–¥ Basic Pointer Example
slides.content:
```go
package main
import "fmt"

func main() {
    x := 42
    p := &x // pointer to x
    fmt.Println(p)  // memory address
    fmt.Println(*p) // value at address
}
```

slides.content:
- Avoid copying large data
- Allow functions to modify values

topic: How do you declare and use pointers?

slides.title: ğŸ¯ Hook: Pointers look scary, but...
slides.content: In Go, they are **simpler** than you think. One symbol does all the magic.

slides.title: âœ Declaring a pointer
slides.content:
```go

```

slides.title: ğŸ”§ Using & and *
slides.content:
```go
x := 10
p := &x  // & gives address
fmt.Println(*p) // * gets value
*p = 20
fmt.Println(x) // now 20
```
